results.doc_title: Scope Proposal: External Engineering Augmentation for The Pets Table (TPT)
results.project_name: External Engineering Augmentation for The Pets Table (TPT)
results.summary: This project involves augmenting TPT's engineering team to deliver three priority initiatives: a post-checkout confirmation page with multipet and add-ons versions, dashboard improvements with repositioned quick actions, and optimized meal display with portion percentage management. All deliverables must be delivered for Web and Mobile Web, fully tested, integrated into existing tech stack, with content editable through Contentful entries.

must_have: Checkout Confirmation Page with 2 versions (multipet and add-ons)
Order summary display matching checkout page format
Logic to show correct version based on pet profile data (number of pets)
Remove 'frying pan' animation loading state
Dashboard quick actions redesigned as accordion above the fold
Scalable component architecture for future feature extensions
Header UI formatting updates
Mobile view order total button changed to icon
Two CTAs below meals: 'Change Meals' and 'Feeding Guide'
Reduced size of meal display on dashboard
Portion percentage management (50%, 75%, 100%)
Calorie-based plan logic (Fresh 750, Dry 750, Mixed 750 for 100% portions)
Two API calls for portion switching: subscription patch and pet profile patch
Portion % hook and badge components
All deliverables for Web and Mobile Web
Full testing and integration into existing tech stack
Documentation for all deliverables
New copy and assets editable through Contentful entries
Tracking implementation

decisions.what: Show multipet CTA if user has multiple pets, otherwise show add-ons store CTA
decisions.rationale: To increase take rate of add-ons, retention, and multipet penetration based on user context

decisions.what: Remove frying pan animation from checkout flow
decisions.rationale: Current animation gives impression user needs to cook the food, which is misleading

decisions.what: Move quick actions above the fold as accordion
decisions.rationale: Active users struggling to find subscription management features; improve discoverability and reduce churn

decisions.what: Implement calorie-based portion logic in frontend for mixed plans
decisions.rationale: API returns mixed plan for 50/75% portions, requiring frontend handling

technical: Quiz Allergens experiment setup (to be repurposed)

success_metrics: Increased user engagement with core functionalities

results.summary: Replication of the US factor form Shopify B2B store for a Canadian factor. The project involves setting up a pilot store with static content and minimal integrations, including URL configuration, core infrastructure, and basic tracking. The approach prioritizes uploading the entire catalog once and managing item visibility weekly rather than building complex integrations initially.

must_have: URL configuration and setup
Core infrastructure setup
Basic tracking (provided by Shopify)
Catalog upload capability
Item visibility management (enable/disable items weekly)
Static content implementation
nice_to_have: CRM connectors for advanced tracking
Integration between catalog and menu management systems
Automated nutritional information entry
out_of_scope: Weekly menu uploads (replaced by catalog visibility management)
Offshore menu management via Hello Connect

decisions.what: Use static content with minimal initial integrations for Canadian pilot
decisions.rationale: More efficient to start simple and avoid complex integrations; allows for faster deployment and lower cost

decisions.what: Upload entire catalog once and manage item visibility weekly
decisions.rationale: More efficient than weekly menu uploads; text and images are easy but nutritional information entry is time-consuming

decisions.what: Allocate one product resource and one engineering resource for approximately two weeks
decisions.rationale: Estimated effort required for URL setup, infrastructure work, and tracking implementation

team: Engineering resource (availability needs to be secured)
Samir and Allison (referenced for US store launch)
external: Hello Connect (previously attempted offshore partner, not recommended)

success_metrics: Successful replication of US store functionality
Cost containment under $100k USD one-time charge

results.doc_title: PRD: Beam Integration for The Pets Table
results.project_name: Beam Integration for The Pets Table
results.summary: Integration of Beam, a social impact platform, into The Pets Table's conversion funnel to allow customers to donate a percentage of their purchase to a charity of their choice. The project aims to improve conversion rates and retention by transforming the subscription decision into a mission-driven, emotional experience. V1 focuses on conversion funnel touchpoints only, excluding post-purchase features.

must_have: Early funnel teaser informing users about donation option (loading page, quiz popup, or registration page)
Charity opt-in and selection component on checkout/payment page
Optional charity selection accessible to users
A/B test setup with 50/50 split using Statsig platform
Manual monthly sharing of transaction data with selected foundation and user_id
Tracking of gross CVR as primary metric
nice_to_have: Thank you message/confirmation after user selects charity
Selection acknowledgement on Thank You Page displaying selected charity and impact reminder
out_of_scope: API integration for automated data sharing (deferred to V2)

decisions.what: Limit V1 to conversion funnel only
decisions.rationale: Focus initial version on conversion improvement before expanding to post-purchase experience

decisions.what: Manual monthly transaction data sharing for V1
decisions.rationale: Avoid API integration complexity in initial version

decisions.what: Use Statsig for experimentation platform
decisions.rationale: Existing platform used by The Pets Table team

team: The Pets Table technical implementation team

success_metrics: Micro conversion rate from allocation page to next page

entities.name: Maria Chelminska
entities.role: Editor/Document owner

entities.role: Pet food subscription company implementing Beam integration

entities.name: Beam
entities.role: Social impact integration platform enabling charity donations

entities.name: Statsig
entities.role: Experimentation platform for A/B testing

entities.name: Figma
entities.role: Design documentation tool (referenced with link)

results.summary: This initiative aims to streamline the subscription management experience for existing The Pets Table users while enhancing engagement and emotional connection. The project focuses on a complete overhaul of the Active User Dashboard experience across desktop and mobile views, addressing usability issues inherited from HelloFresh Group design elements, improving information hierarchy, and adding personalized content to foster emotional connection with pet owners.

must_have: Rework header/burger menu to improve navigation
Improve Pet Switcher discoverability for multi-pet households
Enhance add-on visibility and prominence, especially on mobile
Optimize space usage and reduce wasted space for non-critical information
Improve mobile visibility and experience
Create cleaner information hierarchy
Move Dashboard to Header (consider renaming to 'Home')
Add Pet Profile link in Header (currently links to Settings)
Add RAF with 'Send free food' copy in Header
Add Contact Us to Header
Move FAQ, Our Kitchen, Why Switch, Reviews, and About Us to footer
nice_to_have: Pet Photo Upload feature for emotional engagement
Personal elements (pet photos) throughout dashboard
Feeding tips content
Add-ons Store in header or more exposure on dashboard
Feeding Guide additional entry points
Show detailed order information (exact items, quantities, flavors)
Display prices in cart and monthly delivery prices
Entry point for customers to provide feedback on recent box
Product benefits video (similar to other brands)
Product marketing content including % stats, social proof, and product claims
Content that drives repurchase and reminds users of product value

decisions.what: Separate Pet Profile page improvement into different initiative
decisions.rationale: Can be reprioritized on roadmap but not part of current dashboard simplification scope

decisions.what: UI changes will require branching out from WL code
decisions.rationale: Additional overhead costs for maintenance

decisions.what: Dog death management process already exists
decisions.rationale: Profile no longer visible once dog marked as passed away

technical: HelloFresh Group WL code (White Label code)
Multi-week calendar navigation system inherited from HelloFresh
team: Product marketing team (for content and claims strategy)

success_metrics: Decrease Time to find next-delivery management options (e.g., 'Change meals')
Increase Engagement by launching new 'Excitement' features (such as Pet Photo Upload)

results.doc_title: PRD: Beam Integration for The Pets Table
results.project_name: Beam Integration for The Pets Table
results.summary: Integration of Beam, a social impact platform, into The Pets Table's conversion funnel to allow customers to donate a percentage of their purchase to a charity of their choice. The project aims to improve conversion rates and retention by transforming the subscription decision into a mission-driven, emotional experience. V1 focuses on conversion funnel touchpoints only, excluding post-purchase features.

must_have: Charity selection component on checkout/payment page
Early funnel teaser informing users about donation option
Optional charity selection accessible to users
A/B test setup with 50/50 split (control vs variation)
Manual monthly sharing of transaction data with selected foundation and user_id
Statsig experimentation platform implementation
nice_to_have: Thank you message after user interacts with selection component
Selection confirmation/acknowledgement for users
Multiple charity options (local shelters, state-level, international)
out_of_scope: Automated API integration for data sharing (deferred to V2)

decisions.what: Limit V1 to conversion funnel only
decisions.rationale: Focus initial version on conversion improvement before expanding to post-purchase experience

decisions.what: Manual monthly transaction data sharing for V1
decisions.rationale: Defer API automation to V2 to accelerate initial launch

decisions.what: Charity selection placement on checkout/payment step
decisions.rationale: Primary interaction point for user charity selection, though noted as potentially late in journey

decisions.what: 50/50 A/B test split using Statsig
decisions.rationale: Measure impact on gross CVR and secondary metrics

team: The Pets Table technical implementation team

success_metrics: Micro conversion rate from allocation page to next page

results.summary: Integration of Beam, a social impact platform, into The Pets Table's conversion funnel to allow customers to donate a percentage of their purchase to a charity of their choice. The project aims to improve conversion rates and retention by transforming the subscription decision into a mission-driven, emotional experience. V1 focuses on conversion funnel touchpoints only, excluding post-purchase features.

must_have: Early funnel teaser informing users about donation option (loading screen, quiz popup, or registration page)

results.summary: A project to optimize ThePetsTable's registration/sign-up page experience by improving the sign-up CTA and potentially adding social login options. The initiative aims to enhance customer intent and conversion rates, though data shows the current registration page has minimal friction with only 0.63% drop-off between registration and address pages, significantly better than HelloFresh's 45% drop-off rate.

must_have: Keep the registration page (not remove it)
Improve sign-up CTA to increase customer intent
Maintain email auto-population from WKND cookie
Verify whether prospect already has an account
Redirect existing users to reactivation page with applicable discounts
Monitor 2-week conversion data post-improvements
nice_to_have: Add social login options (Apple, Google, Facebook)
Move from transactional tone to emotional tone in UI
Optimize page UI for better customer experience
out_of_scope: Adding password rules or checks (currently not implemented)

decisions.what: Keep the registration page
decisions.rationale: Registration page is necessary to verify existing accounts, redirect to reactivation page, prevent redundant navigation through signup funnel, and has minimal drop-off (0.63%)

decisions.what: Keep the Add-ons promotional banner
decisions.rationale: Previous experiments with seasonal promotional banners showed positive CVR improvements; customers learn about Add-ons for first time on this page; lack of experimental bandwidth for testing alternatives

decisions.what: Prioritize improving sign-up CTA over other changes
decisions.rationale: Focus on content optimization to increase customer intent to complete checkout with minimal functional changes

technical: Site cookies (for session management and redirect)
Statsig (experimentation platform, referenced for HelloFresh data)
external: Social login providers (Apple, Google, Facebook) - if implemented

success_metrics: Conversion rate (CVR) from registration to address page
Session drop-off percentage between registration and address pages
Password submission rate after email entry

entities.name: ThePetsTable (TPT/PetsTable)
entities.role: Primary product being optimized

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.role: Comparison benchmark showing 45% drop-off rate and 2.66% conversion increase from social logins

entities.name: GoodChop
entities.role: Mentioned as comparison for session percentages to address page

entities.name: WKND cookie
entities.role: Technical system enabling email auto-population on registration page

entities.name: Statsig
entities.role: Experimentation platform used for HelloFresh social login testing

results.summary: Analysis and optimization of ThePetsTable registration page to improve customer experience and conversion rates. Despite low drop-off rates (11.62% to 12.25%), the project explores UI improvements to move from transactional to emotional tone and considers adding social login options. The registration page will be retained as it serves critical functions for user verification and reactivation.

must_have: Keep the registration page (not remove it)
Improve sign up CTA to increase customer intent
Monitor 2-week conversions post WKND cookie improvements
Maintain email autopopulation from WKND cookie
Verify whether prospect already has an account
nice_to_have: Use social logins (Apple, Google, Facebook) - P2 priority
Move from transactional to emotional tone in UI
Optimize page UI for better customer experience
out_of_scope: Immediate removal of Add-ons promotional banner (decision to keep it)

decisions.what: Keep the registration page
decisions.rationale: Registration page is necessary to verify existing accounts, redirect to reactivation page, prevent redundant navigation, and adjust applicable discounts. Drop-off rates are already low (11.62% to 12.25%)

decisions.what: Keep Add-ons promotional banner
decisions.rationale: Previous experiments with seasonal promotional banners showed positive CVR improvements. Customers learn about Add-ons for first time on this page. Limited experimental bandwidth available.

decisions.what: Make minimal functional changes to registration page
decisions.rationale: Page already performs well with low friction after email autopopulation feature

decisions.what: Deprioritize social logins (P2)
decisions.rationale: Customer demographics skew older (>50% are 50+ years old) who are less likely to use social logins. HelloFresh saw 2.66% conversion increase, but impact expected to be low for PetsTable

technical: Social login APIs (Apple, Google, Facebook) - if implemented

success_metrics: Conversion rate (CVR) from registration to address page
Session percentage reaching Address page vs Registration page
Password submission rate (currently 96.6% based on HelloFresh benchmark)

entities.name: ThePetsTable
entities.role: Primary product being analyzed, shows 12.25% Address page visits vs 11.62% Registration visits

entities.name: PetsTable

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.role: Comparison benchmark showing 45%+ drop-off from registration to address page, 3.4% abandon without password, 2.66% conversion increase from social logins

entities.name: GoodChop
entities.role: Mentioned as comparison for session percentages to Address page

entities.name: WKND cookie
entities.role: Technical system enabling email autopopulation on registration page

entities.name: Statsig
entities.role: Experimentation platform used by HelloFresh for social login testing

entities.name: Apple
entities.role: Proposed social login provider
